results.display_title: Miss Peregrine’s Home for Peculiar Children
results.headline: Review: In ‘Miss Peregrine’s Home,’ Chasing Grandpa’s Stories Down a Rabbit Hole
results.summary_short: Tim Burton’s adaptation of the novel by Ransom Riggs describes the adventures of an adolescent who travels through time to prove his grandfather right.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Miss Peregrine’s Home for Peculiar Children

results.headline: Review: ‘Harry & Snowman’ Recalls a Man and a Horse of Powerful Haunches
results.summary_short: Ron Davis’s documentary is about Snowman, a white gelding and championship show jumper in his time, and Harry deLeyer, who raised him.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Harry & Snowman

results.headline: Review: In ‘Amanda Knox,’ a Murder and Journalism Run Amok
results.summary_short: This documentary about the case of an exchange student killed in Italy focuses less on an accused killer and more on unprincipled journalism and unapologetic sexism.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Amanda Knox

results.headline: Review: Youthful Recklessness Finds Adventure on the Road in ‘American Honey’
results.summary_short: Andrea Arnold’s new feature (her first set in the United States), with a cast mostly of newcomers, follows a band of aimless youths around the country.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of American Honey

results.headline: Review: In ‘Girl Asleep,’ Floating Through a Teenage Fantasia
results.summary_short: Rosemary Myers’s hybrid of film and children’s theater follows Greta, a young wallflower whose social woes turn surreal when she runs into the woods behind her home.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Girl Asleep

results.headline: Review: In ‘Denial,’ Confronting a Holocaust Revisionist in Court
results.summary_short: The libel trial of a historian, brought by a Holocaust denier, is dramatized in this sober and methodical film. But the movie lacks an emotional flash point.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Denial

results.headline: Review: In ‘Among the Believers,’ a Cleric Holds Sway
results.summary_short: This documentary takes the viewer inside the Islamic schools in Pakistan run by the fiery Abdul Aziz.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Among the Believers

results.headline: Review: ‘Danny Says,’ a Paean to a Rock Gadfly and Tastemaker
results.summary_short: Brendan Toller’s documentary about the music manager and journalist Danny Fields aims to reacquaint viewers with his influence, including the rise of punk.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Danny Says

results.headline: Review: ‘Do Not Resist,’ or When a Police Force Becomes an Army
results.summary_short: More details on the scope and scale of the militarization of American police forces would help bolster this documentary.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Do Not Resist

results.headline: Review: The Animated ‘Long Way North’ Finds a Girl on a Journey
results.summary_short: The movie follows 14-year-old Sacha in the late 1800s as she goes off in search of her lost grandfather.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Long Way North

results.headline: Review: In ‘A Man Called Ove,’ Don’t Let That Scowl Fool You
results.summary_short: Adapted from a best-selling Swedish novel, this film stars Rolf Lassgard as a gruff, unemployed railroad worker who befriends immigrants who are his new neighbors.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Man Called Ove

results.display_title: The Rolling Stones Olé, Olé, Olé
results.headline: Review: ‘The Rolling Stones Olé, Olé, Olé!’ Captures Tour Euphoria in Latin America
results.summary_short: The documentary follows the Stones to eight countries, including Cuba, recalling when rock truly mattered as a force for change.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Rolling Stones Olé, Olé, Olé

results.headline: Review: ‘Masterminds,’ a Tale of Grand Larceny and Meager Gray Matter
results.summary_short: This comedy from Jared Hess stars Zach Galifianakis as a real-life felon who tried to steal millions of dollars in 1997.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Masterminds

results.display_title: Never Surrender: The Ed Ramsey Story
results.headline: Review: ‘Never Surrender: The Ed Ramsey Story,’ an Overdue Paean to a War Hero
results.summary_short: A documentary honors Mr. Ramsey, an Army officer in the Philippines when it fell to the Japanese in World War II, and later a wartime underground leader.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Never Surrender: The Ed Ramsey Story

results.headline: Review: ‘Passage to Mars,’ an Otherworldly Voyage on Earth
results.summary_short: Scientists train for Mars exploration during a long mission in the unyielding cold of the Arctic, testing equipment that may one day be used in space.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Passage to Mars

results.headline: Review: In ‘Deepwater Horizon,’ Oil, Fire and Greed
results.summary_short: Peter Berg’s film dramatizes a familiar story and stands as a work of popular narrative for an age of corporate impunity.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Deepwater Horizon

results.headline: Review: In ‘Tharlo,’ a Shepherd’s Life Upended by a Trip to the City
results.summary_short: A black-and-white film from the Tibetan director Pema Tseden has a fleeting charm until the narrative takes a grim turn.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tharlo

results.headline: Review: ‘Sand Storm’ Follows a Bedouin Mother and Daughter in Quiet Revolts
results.summary_short: In her feature debut, the Israeli filmmaker Elite Zexer directs a story about women constricted by, and pushing back against, cultural traditions.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sand Storm

results.headline: Review: ‘Chicken People,’ Pampering Royalty That Clucks
results.summary_short: This documentary, directed by Nicole Lucas Haimes, looks at devotees of these fair fowl on the show circuit.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chicken People

results.headline: Review: An Unflinching Portrayal of Impending Mortality in ‘Chronic’
results.summary_short: The first English-language film from Michel Franco, centering on a stoop-shouldered caregiver for terminally ill patients, ends with a blow to your equilibrium.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chronic
